newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nippon Life to invest in US corp bonds in 1997/98.
newsitem.headline: Nippon Life to invest in US corp bonds in 1997/98.

text.p: Nippon Life Insurance Co is planning to diversify its foreign bond investments by investing in U.S. corporate bonds starting in the next fiscal year from April, a company official said on Thursday.
The company aims to invest several billion yen in those bonds during fiscal 1997/98, but the official declined to give exact details on the volume or the names of the bonds.
The company plans to buy U.S. corporate bonds in an attempt to acquire higher returns as domestic interest rates are expected to crawl at record low levels, he said.
"We are seeking instruments with a return of at least four percent per year, but it"s impossible to achieve that goal by investing in domestic interest rates," he said.
The official also said U.S. corporate bonds were reliable, with higher liquidity than other markets.
Nippon Life is currently concentrating on foreign government bonds in its offshore bond investments, but had avoided foreign corporate bonds in the past.
In November, Nippon Life said that it planned more than 100 billion yen worth of new foreign bond investments in the second half of the current fiscal year.
